thread.title: Friday lineups: Weaver, Angels try to turn it around against Rangers
thread.title_full: Friday lineups: Weaver, Angels try to turn it around against Rangers

author: JEFF FLETCHER
title: Friday lineups: Weaver, Angels try to turn it around against Rangers
text:
SEND PDF Angels' Jered Weaver watches from the dugout during his most recent start last weekend against the Mariners. He came out of that game early with shoulder discomfort. KYUSUNG GONG, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 
ARLINGTON, Texas -- The Angels will try to get back into the wild-card race with a victory over the Texas Rangers at 5 p.m. Friday. 
The Angels are not quite in a must-win situation, but it's close to being desperate. 
They trail the Houston Astros by one game, and they are tied with the Minnesota Twins. All three teams have three games left, starting Friday. The Astros are at the Arizona Diamondbacks and the Twins are at home against the Kansas City Royals. 
If the Angels win and the Astros lose Friday, their chances increase quite a bit. Not only would they be tied, but the Rangers would lock up the division and have no more incentive to win the last two days of the series. 
First things first, Jered Weaver starts for the Angels Friday against Martin Perez. Weaver came out of his last start with shoulder discomfort. If he has any trouble early in this game, expect Mat Latos to be up quickly. 
The lineups...
